name: Prop-2-en-1-ol
Reason: Starting with the base structure ethene (C2H4) which has a melting point of -169.2°C, we add the considerations for the functional groups present in prop-2-en-1-ol (allyl alcohol). Adding a hydroxyl (OH) group typically raises the melting point due to the ability to form hydrogen bonds: +40°C. The presence of the additional methylene (-CH2-) group, which increases the molecular weight and size, can also contribute to an increase in melting point: +10°C. However, the double bond in the prop-2-en-1-ol does not influence the melting point significantly compared to solely the presence of the alkane chain because the double bond’s effect on the melting point is more subtle and can depend on molecular packing in the solid state.
